subject: RE: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse
msgSnippet: Hi Bill, What I did, under my project, I created 2 source folders (src and test).  I then imported my application code into src and test code into test.
messageBody:
Hi Bill,

What I did, under my project, I created 2 source folders (src and test). I
then imported my application code into src and test code into test. Eclipse
then automatically created a bin directory where the compiled classes go.
Never had a problem.

Hope this helps. Check out the Eclipse newsgroups and mail archives too.

Later,
-Larry

-----Original Message-----
From: Bill de hÓra [mailto:dehora@...]
Sent: Wednesday, November 13, 2002 12:59 PM
To: junit
Subject: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse


Hi,

Has anyone had any success getting Eclipse to understand a project
whose junit code is organized as follows:

src/
java/
a/b/c
test/
a/b/c

I imagine it can be done, but I've not been able to get Eclipse to
shut up - it says it can't find src/test's dependencies, ie the ones
in src/java

Bill de hÓra
